Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence of the coronavirus being found in chickens in Pakistan.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that signs of coronavirus have started appearing in chickens in Pakistan.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing enough evidence or support for the assertion that coronavirus signs have appeared in chickens.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence provided to support the assertion.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the coronavirus can be transmitted through chicken meat.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider the alternative explanation that the photos shared are unrelated to the coronavirus and are being shared out of context.
